ygData.subject: Re: Mana
ygData.msgSnippet: heh, i was just about to post asking if that could be the case ... From: Sergey Bukhman  To:  Sent: Sunday,
ygData.messageBody:
heh, i was just about to post asking if that could be the case

----- Original Message -----
From: Sergey Bukhman <sergeyb@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, October 24, 1999 4:05 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Mana


> From: Sergey Bukhman <sergeyb@...>
>
>
>
> Shadowwalker wrote:
> >
> > From: "Shadowwalker" <Shadowwalker@...>
> >
> > Since it only costs about 30 to 50pp to master brewing (and alcohol
> > tolerance at the same time), I am going to test this theory pretty soon.
> >
>
> Well, I tried it, and it turned out to be BS. Thing is, when you drink,
> your INT goes down so it looks like your mana bar fills up, when in fact
> you just get less mana capacity and the current mana you have looks like
> it's a lot more in comparison.
>
> It's kind of like when you cast shielding on yourself and it looks like
> your HP go down, when in fact your HP capacity grows and the current HP
> looks like it's less in comparison.
>
> I still would like someone with maxed Alcohol Tolerance to try it and
> see if his mana goes up without his INT going down. Then we'll have
> something.
>
> --
> Sergey
>
> Worker bees can leave
> Even drones can fly away
> The queen is their slave
>
>
